skill.name: replicate-handler
skill.description: Integrate with Replicate AI for running models (image generation, LLMs, etc.).
skill.summary: Provides TypeScript integration with Replicate AI API for running machine learning models
skill.author: AayushBaniya2006

security_audit.summary: This skill provides TypeScript type definitions and usage patterns for the Replicate AI API. Static analysis detected 55 potential issues, but manual review confirms these are false positives. The skill requires network access for legitimate API calls and environment variable access for authentication tokens. No security vulnerabilities identified.

low_findings.title: Environment Variable Usage for API Authentication
low_findings.description: The skill accesses process.env.REPLICATE_API_TOKEN for authenticating with the Replicate API. This is standard practice for API key management and requires users to properly secure their environment variables.

low_findings.title: Network Access Required for API Communication
low_findings.description: The skill makes HTTP requests to Replicate API endpoints for running machine learning models. This is the core functionality and requires network access to function properly.

content.user_title: Integrate Replicate AI Models into Your Projects
content.value_statement: Running machine learning models in production requires reliable API integration and proper handling of long-running tasks. This skill provides TypeScript patterns for Replicate AI integration with support for both quick runs and asynchronous model execution.
actual_capabilities: Provides complete TypeScript type definitions for the Replicate SDK
Supports synchronous model execution using replicate.run for quick tasks
Enables asynchronous predictions with polling patterns for long-running models
Includes integration patterns with Inngest for handling video generation and compute-intensive tasks
Handles model predictions with status tracking (starting, processing, succeeded, failed, canceled)
Supports webhook configuration for prediction callbacks
limitations: Requires valid Replicate API token stored in environment variables
Does not include error handling or retry logic implementations
TypeScript definitions are provided as reference only and require the official replicate npm package
Long-running task patterns require additional tools like Inngest for production use

use_cases.title: Implement AI Image Generation
use_cases.description: Integrate Stable Diffusion or other image generation models into your application with proper async handling and status tracking.

use_cases.title: Run LLM Inference in Production
use_cases.description: Execute large language model predictions with timeout handling and webhook notifications for completion events.
use_cases.target_user: Backend engineers deploying machine learning services

use_cases.title: Process Video Generation Tasks
use_cases.description: Handle long-running video generation workloads with polling patterns that prevent timeout issues in serverless environments.
use_cases.target_user: DevOps engineers building media processing pipelines

prompt_templates.title: Basic Model Execution
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to run a Replicate model for text-to-image generation using the replicate.run method
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick execution of models that complete in seconds

prompt_templates.title: Setup API Authentication
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me configure the REPLICATE_API_TOKEN environment variable and initialize the Replicate client in my TypeScript project

prompt_templates.title: Handle Long-Running Predictions
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a polling pattern with Inngest for a video generation model that might take several minutes to complete

prompt_templates.title: Add Webhook Notifications
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure webhook callbacks for model completion events and implement the webhook validation logic using the provided types
prompt_templates.scenario: Event-driven architecture with async model execution

output_examples.input: Show me how to run a Replicate model for text-to-image generation
output_examples.output:
Here is a TypeScript implementation using replicate.run:

The code imports Replicate, initializes with your API token from environment variables, and calls replicate.run with the model identifier and input parameters. The output contains the generated image URL which you can download or display.

output_examples.input: How do I handle a prediction that takes 5 minutes to complete?
output_examples.output:
For long-running predictions, use the predictions API with polling:

This pattern creates a prediction, then polls every 5 seconds until the status is succeeded, failed, or canceled. For serverless environments, integrate with Inngest to handle the polling without consuming execution time.

best_practices: Store API tokens in environment variables and never commit them to version control
Use the predictions API with polling for models that take longer than 30 seconds to complete
Implement proper error handling for failed predictions and network timeouts
anti_patterns: Using replicate.run for video generation or other long-running tasks without timeout handling
Hardcoding API tokens directly in source code instead of using environment variables
Polling prediction status in tight loops without sleep intervals between requests

faq.question: What is Replicate AI and why would I use this skill?
faq.answer: Replicate is a platform for running machine learning models in the cloud. This skill provides TypeScript integration patterns and type definitions to help you implement Replicate API calls in your applications.

faq.question: Do I need to install any npm packages to use this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, you need to install the official replicate package using npm install replicate. This skill provides usage patterns and type references for that package.

faq.question: How do I get a Replicate API token?
faq.answer: You need to sign up for a Replicate account at replicate.com and generate an API token from your account settings. Store this token in your environment variables as REPLICATE_API_TOKEN.

faq.question: What is the difference between replicate.run and the predictions API?
faq.answer: replicate.run is a simplified method for quick tasks that complete in seconds. The predictions API gives you more control for long-running tasks, allowing you to create a prediction and poll for completion without blocking.

faq.question: Why does the skill mention Inngest for long-running tasks?
faq.answer: Inngest provides step.sleep functionality that allows you to poll for prediction completion without consuming server resources or hitting timeout limits in serverless environments.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use with sensitive data?
faq.answer: The skill itself only provides TypeScript patterns and type definitions. When using Replicate API, your data is sent to Replicate servers. Review Replicate privacy policy and data handling practices before sending sensitive information.
